description: Returns the information about the log transformer associated with this log group. This operation returns data only for transformers created at the log group level. To get information for an account-level transformer, use DescribeAccountPolicies.

parameters.name: logGroupIdentifier
parameters.description: Specify either the name or ARN of the log group to return transformer information for. If the log group is in a source account and you are using a monitoring account, you must use the log group ARN.

nested_items.name: logGroupIdentifier
nested_items.description: The ARN of the log group that you specified in your request.

nested_items.name: creationTime
nested_items.description: The creation time of the transformer, expressed as the number of milliseconds after Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC.

nested_items.name: lastModifiedTime
nested_items.description: The date and time when this transformer was most recently modified, expressed as the number of milliseconds after Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC.

nested_items.name: transformerConfig
nested_items.description: This sructure contains the configuration of the requested transformer.

nested_items.name: entries
nested_items.description: An array of objects, where each object contains the information about one key to add to the log event.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The key of the new entry to be added to the log event.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the new entry to be added to the log event.

nested_items.name: overwriteIfExists
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to overwrite the value if the key already exists in the log event. If you omit this, the default is false.

nested_items.name: copyValue
nested_items.description: Use this parameter to include the copyValue processor in your transformer.

nested_items.name: entries
nested_items.description: An array of CopyValueEntry objects, where each object contains the information about one field value to copy.

nested_items.name: source
nested_items.description: The key to copy.

nested_items.name: target
nested_items.description: The key of the field to copy the value to.

nested_items.name: overwriteIfExists
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to overwrite the value if the destination key already exists. If you omit this, the default is false.

nested_items.name: quoteCharacter
nested_items.description: The character used used as a text qualifier for a single column of data. If you omit this, the double quotation mark " character is used.

nested_items.name: delimiter
nested_items.description: The character used to separate each column in the original comma-separated value log event. If you omit this, the processor looks for the comma , character as the delimiter.

nested_items.name: columns
nested_items.description: An array of names to use for the columns in the transformed log event.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: source
nested_items.description: The path to the field in the log event that has the comma separated values to be parsed. If you omit this value, the whole log message is processed.

nested_items.name: dateTimeConverter
nested_items.description: Use this parameter to include the datetimeConverter processor in your transformer.

nested_items.name: source
nested_items.description: The key to apply the date conversion to.

nested_items.name: target
nested_items.description: The JSON field to store the result in.

nested_items.name: targetFormat
nested_items.description: The datetime format to use for the converted data in the target field.

nested_items.name: matchPatterns
nested_items.description: A list of patterns to match against the source field.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: sourceTimezone
nested_items.description: The time zone of the source field. If you omit this, the default used is the UTC zone.

nested_items.name: targetTimezone
nested_items.description: The time zone of the target field. If you omit this, the default used is the UTC zone.

nested_items.name: locale
nested_items.description: The locale of the source field. If you omit this, the default of locale.ROOT is used.

nested_items.name: deleteKeys
nested_items.description: Use this parameter to include the deleteKeys processor in your transformer.

nested_items.name: withKeys
nested_items.description: The list of keys to delete.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: source
nested_items.description: The path to the field in the log event that you want to parse. If you omit this value, the whole log message is parsed.

nested_items.name: match
nested_items.description: The grok pattern to match against the log event. For a list of supported grok patterns, see Supported grok patterns.

nested_items.name: listToMap
nested_items.description: Use this parameter to include the listToMap processor in your transformer.

nested_items.name: source
nested_items.description: The key in the log event that has a list of objects that will be converted to a map.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The key of the field to be extracted as keys in the generated map.

nested_items.name: valueKey
nested_items.description: If this is specified, the values that you specify in this parameter will be extracted from the source objects and put into the values of the generated map. Otherwise, original objects in the source list will be put into the values of the generated map.

nested_items.name: target
nested_items.description: The key of the field that will hold the generated map.

nested_items.name: flatten
nested_items.description: A Boolean value to indicate whether the list will be flattened into single items. Specify true to flatten the list. The default is false.

nested_items.name: flattenedElement
nested_items.description: If you set flatten to true, use flattenedElement to specify which element, first or last, to keep.

nested_items.name: lowerCaseString
nested_items.description: Use this parameter to include the lowerCaseString processor in your transformer.

nested_items.name: withKeys
nested_items.description: The array caontaining the keys of the fields to convert to lowercase.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: entries
nested_items.description: An array of objects, where each object contains the information about one key to move.

nested_items.name: source
nested_items.description: The key to move.

nested_items.name: target
nested_items.description: The key to move to.

nested_items.name: overwriteIfExists
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to overwrite the value if the destination key already exists. If you omit this, the default is false.

nested_items.name: parseCloudfront
nested_items.description: Use this parameter to include the parseCloudfront processor in your transformer.

nested_items.name: source
nested_items.description: Omit this parameter and the whole log message will be processed by this processor. No other value than @message is allowed for source.

nested_items.name: parseJSON
nested_items.description: Use this parameter to include the parseJSON processor in your transformer.

nested_items.name: source
nested_items.description: Path to the field in the log event that will be parsed. Use dot notation to access child fields. For example, store.book.

nested_items.name: destination
nested_items.description: The location to put the parsed key value pair into. If you omit this parameter, it is placed under the root node.

nested_items.name: parseKeyValue
nested_items.description: Use this parameter to include the parseKeyValue processor in your transformer.

nested_items.name: source
nested_items.description: Path to the field in the log event that will be parsed. Use dot notation to access child fields. For example, store.book.

nested_items.name: destination
nested_items.description: The destination field to put the extracted key-value pairs into.

nested_items.name: fieldDelimiter
nested_items.description: The field delimiter string that is used between key-value pairs in the original log events. If you omit this, the ampersand & character is used.

nested_items.name: keyValueDelimiter
nested_items.description: The delimiter string to use between the key and value in each pair in the transformed log event.

nested_items.name: keyPrefix
nested_items.description: If you want to add a prefix to all transformed keys, specify it here.

nested_items.name: nonMatchValue
nested_items.description: A value to insert into the value field in the result, when a key-value pair is not successfully split.

nested_items.name: overwriteIfExists
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to overwrite the value if the destination key already exists. If you omit this, the default is false.

nested_items.name: parseRoute53
nested_items.description: Use this parameter to include the parseRoute53 processor in your transformer.

nested_items.name: source
nested_items.description: Omit this parameter and the whole log message will be processed by this processor. No other value than @message is allowed for source.

nested_items.name: parsePostgres
nested_items.description: Use this parameter to include the parsePostGres processor in your transformer.

nested_items.name: source
nested_items.description: Omit this parameter and the whole log message will be processed by this processor. No other value than @message is allowed for source.

nested_items.name: source
nested_items.description: Omit this parameter and the whole log message will be processed by this processor. No other value than @message is allowed for source.

nested_items.name: source
nested_items.description: Omit this parameter and the whole log message will be processed by this processor. No other value than @message is allowed for source.

nested_items.name: renameKeys
nested_items.description: Use this parameter to include the renameKeys processor in your transformer.

nested_items.name: entries
nested_items.description: An array of RenameKeyEntry objects, where each object contains the information about a single key to rename.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The key to rename.

nested_items.name: renameTo
nested_items.description: The string to use for the new key name.

nested_items.name: overwriteIfExists
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to overwrite the existing value if the destination key already exists. The default is false.

nested_items.name: splitString
nested_items.description: Use this parameter to include the splitString processor in your transformer.

nested_items.name: entries
nested_items.description: An array of SplitStringEntry objects, where each object contains the information about one field to split.

nested_items.name: source
nested_items.description: The key of the field to split.

nested_items.name: delimiter
nested_items.description: The separator characters to split the string entry on.

nested_items.name: substituteString
nested_items.description: Use this parameter to include the substituteString processor in your transformer.

nested_items.name: entries
nested_items.description: An array of objects, where each object contains the information about one key to match and replace.

nested_items.name: source
nested_items.description: The key to modify.

nested_items.name: from
nested_items.description: The regular expression string to be replaced. Special regex characters such as [ and ] must be escaped using \ when using double quotes and with when using single quotes. For more information, see Class Pattern on the Oracle web site.

nested_items.name: to
nested_items.description: The string to be substituted for each match of from.

nested_items.name: trimString
nested_items.description: Use this parameter to include the trimString processor in your transformer.

nested_items.name: withKeys
nested_items.description: The array containing the keys of the fields to trim.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: typeConverter
nested_items.description: Use this parameter to include the typeConverter processor in your transformer.

nested_items.name: entries
nested_items.description: An array of TypeConverterEntry objects, where each object contains the information about one field to change the type of.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The key with the value that is to be converted to a different type.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type to convert the field value to. Valid values are integer, double, string and boolean.

nested_items.name: upperCaseString
nested_items.description: Use this parameter to include the upperCaseString processor in your transformer.

nested_items.name: withKeys
nested_items.description: The array of containing the keys of the field to convert to uppercase.
(string) ---
